Environmental Science.name: Tidal Rhythms & Photosynthetic Wonders
Environmental Science.description: Explore the fascinating interplay of tides and the process of photosynthesis. This quiz delves into the cyclical nature of our oceans and the vital role plants play in sustaining life. Test your knowledge of these fundamental environmental concepts.

questions.text: What is produced during photosynthesis?
questions.hint: This gas is essential for animal life and released by plants as a byproduct.

questions.text: What force causes an ice cream cone to fly off of a spinning merry-go-round?
questions.hint: This force is related to the outward pull felt on spinning objects.

questions.text: On average, what length of time passes between high tides?
questions.hint: This interval is influenced by the lunar cycle, occurring roughly twice a day.

Environmental Science.name: Scottish Flora, Fauna & Fails
Environmental Science.description: Journey through the natural heritage of Scotland and beyond. This quiz covers iconic Scottish emblems, diverse animal life, and a notorious environmental disaster.  Are you ready to test your knowledge of Scotland's natural world and a significant ecological event?

questions.text: What kind of animal is a peregrine?
questions.hint: This creature is known for its incredible speed, especially when diving.

questions.text: Which of these plants is the national emblem of Scotland?
questions.hint: This prickly plant is a symbol of resilience in Scottish culture.

questions.text: What is produced during photosynthesis?
questions.hint: This gas is essential for animal life and released by plants as a byproduct.

questions.text: Where did the Exxon Valdez run aground in March of 1989?
questions.hint: This Alaskan location is named after a British royal and known for its pristine waters.

questions.text: Which of these animals lays eggs?
questions.hint: This animal is an amphibian, unlike the others, which are mammals.

Environmental Science.name: Echoes of the Exxon Valdez
Environmental Science.description: This quiz revisits key environmental concepts and a pivotal moment in ecological history.  From photosynthesis to tidal patterns and the impact of the Exxon Valdez oil spill, assess your understanding of these interconnected elements.

questions.text: What is produced during photosynthesis?

Environmental Science.name: Spinning Seas & Spills
Environmental Science.description: Explore the forces at play in our oceans and the consequences of environmental disasters. This quiz covers tidal patterns, centrifugal force, and the impact of the Exxon Valdez oil spill.
